user_stories.title: As a workflow designer, I want to store a new workflow definition so that I can re-use it later
user_stories.description: This story covers the functionality for a workflow designer to define a new workflow using a structured format (e.g., JSON or XML) and persist it in the system's database. This will allow for the centralized management and reuse of workflow logic.
acceptance_criteria: The API endpoint for creating a workflow definition accepts a valid workflow structure.
The system successfully stores the workflow definition in the database.
A unique identifier is returned upon successful creation of a workflow definition.
Attempting to store an invalid workflow definition returns an appropriate error.
Workflow definitions are versioned or immutably stored to prevent accidental overwrites.

tasks.title: Design workflow definition schema
tasks.description: Define the JSON/XML schema for a workflow definition, including steps, transitions, and associated metadata.

tasks.title: Develop database table for workflow definitions
tasks.description: Create a database table to store workflow definitions, including fields for ID, name, description, definition content, and versioning.

tasks.title: Implement POST /workflows/definitions endpoint
tasks.description: Create the API endpoint to receive and validate new workflow definitions and persist them in the database.

tasks.title: Add schema validation for incoming workflow definitions
tasks.description: Integrate validation logic to ensure incoming workflow definitions conform to the defined schema before storage.

tasks.title: Write unit tests for workflow creation API
tasks.description: Develop unit tests to verify the correct functionality of the workflow definition creation API endpoint, including valid and invalid inputs.

user_stories.title: As a workflow executor, I want to retrieve an existing workflow definition by its ID so that I can initiate a workflow
user_stories.description: This story focuses on the ability of the workflow execution engine to retrieve a specific workflow definition from the database by its unique identifier. This is crucial for initiating workflow instances based on pre-defined structures.
acceptance_criteria: The API endpoint for retrieving a workflow definition accepts a valid workflow ID.
The system returns the complete workflow definition when a valid ID is provided.
If no workflow definition matches the provided ID, an appropriate 'not found' error is returned.
The returned workflow definition matches the structure that was previously stored.

tasks.title: Implement GET /workflows/definitions/{id} endpoint
tasks.description: Create the API endpoint to retrieve a specific workflow definition by its unique identifier.

tasks.title: Develop database query for fetching workflow definitions by ID
tasks.description: Implement the data access logic to fetch a workflow definition from the database using its ID.

tasks.title: Add error handling for 'workflow not found'
tasks.description: Ensure the API properly handles cases where a requested workflow definition ID does not exist.

tasks.title: Write integration tests for workflow retrieval API
tasks.description: Develop integration tests to confirm the API can correctly retrieve previously stored workflow definitions.

user_stories.title: As a backend developer, I want to ensure the workflow definition API is well-documented so that other services can integrate with it
user_stories.description: This technical story addresses the need for comprehensive API documentation to facilitate understanding and integration by other services and developers within the Office Automation project.
acceptance_criteria: API endpoints for workflow definition storage and retrieval are documented using OpenAPI/Swagger.
Request and response schemas are clearly defined in the documentation.
Example requests and responses are provided for each endpoint.
Authentication and authorization requirements are specified.
Error codes and their meanings are listed.

tasks.title: Integrate Swagger/OpenAPI into the project
tasks.description: Set up Swagger/OpenAPI framework for API documentation generation.

tasks.title: Document POST /workflows/definitions endpoint
tasks.description: Add detailed documentation for creating workflow definitions, including request body schema, success and error responses.

tasks.title: Document GET /workflows/definitions/{id} endpoint
tasks.description: Add detailed documentation for retrieving workflow definitions, including path parameters, success and error responses.

tasks.title: Review and refine API documentation
tasks.description: Ensure all relevant details (authentication, error codes, examples) are included and accurate in the generated documentation.
